thinkers.name: Immanuel Kant
thinkers.context: Historical philosopher contributing to classical discussions of teleology and goal-directedness

thinkers.name: Hans Jonas
thinkers.context: Philosopher extending classical discussions relevant to teleonomy

thinkers.name: Martin Heidegger
thinkers.context: Philosopher contributing to classical discussions of goal-directedness and being

thinkers.name: Eörs Szathmáry

thinkers.name: Josh Bongard

concepts.name: Care
concepts.context: Central invariant binding biology, AI, and Buddhism; defined as concern for stress relief and capacity to exert energy toward preferred states

concepts.name: Intelligence
concepts.context: Capacity for identifying and seeking stress relief; substrate-independent ability to display competency in reaching goals despite perturbations

concepts.name: Dukkha
concepts.context: Delta between current state and optimal state; fundamental driver of cognition and action; Buddhist concept of suffering or unsatisfactoriness

concepts.name: Teleonomy
concepts.context: Ability to display competency in reaching goals in some problem space despite changing circumstances; invariant across all intelligent systems

concepts.name: Cognitive Light Cone
concepts.context: Spatiotemporal boundary demarcating the scale of an agent's possible goals and concerns; enables comparison of diverse intelligences

concepts.name: Physical Light Cone
concepts.context: Space of physically achievable states for an agent; differs from care light cone which represents states an agent cares about

concepts.name: Basal Cognition
concepts.context: Field emphasizing continuum of intelligence originating in microbe control loops, scaled throughout multicellular forms; demonstrates intelligence beyond brains

concepts.name: Compassion
concepts.context: Practical care for all sentient beings; emerges from expanded cognitive boundaries and recognition of interconnectedness

concepts.name: Bodhisattva Vow
concepts.context: Commitment to achieve awakening for the benefit of all sentient beings; practical design principle for advancing intelligence

concepts.name: Anatta (Non-Self)
concepts.context: Buddhist doctrine that there is no singular, enduring self; illusory nature of selfhood; foundation for compassion and expanded care

concepts.name: Emptiness
concepts.context: Interdependent and constructed nature of object, agent, and action; nondual understanding of reality

concepts.name: Self as Computational Boundary
concepts.context: Functional boundary defined by scale of goals an agent can represent and pursue; evolving systems whose structure corresponds with goal scale

concepts.name: Homeostatic Loops
concepts.context: Fundamental control mechanisms at multiple scales of biological organization; drive reduction of discrepancy between current and optimal states

concepts.name: Embodiment
concepts.context: Material implementation and substrate of cognitive systems; intelligence is substrate-independent but always embodied

concepts.name: Problem Space
concepts.context: Field that emerges in gap between current and optimal conditions; can exist in multiple spaces (3D behavior, physiological, metabolic, anatomical)

concepts.name: Developmental Bioelectricity
concepts.context: Medium by which non-neural cells form networks to manage morphogenesis and regeneration; precursor to neurobiology

concepts.name: Morphospace
concepts.context: Problem space for solving anatomical and physiological challenges; evolution solved problems here before enabling 3D behavioral space

concepts.name: Gap Junctions
concepts.context: Biophysical connections allowing direct information transfer between cells; enable scaling of cognitive boundaries through functional coupling

concepts.name: Anatomical Homeostasis
concepts.context: Teleonomy capacity of cellular collectives to manage growth and form through bioelectric coordination

concepts.name: Collective Intelligence
concepts.context: Emergent intelligence arising from cooperation and integration of multiple cognitive units at different scales

concepts.name: Multiscale Competency Architecture
concepts.context: Hypothesis about how multiple teleonomy agents link into larger selves; involves competition and cooperation among subunits

concepts.name: Intrinsic Motivation
concepts.context: Self-generated goals and drives in AI systems; key open problem in AI research aligned with biological stress-reduction drives

concepts.name: Reward Function
concepts.context: Parameter driving AI system evolution; analogous to biological stress or dukkha; specifies goals for artificial agents

concepts.name: Reinforcement Learning
concepts.context: AI technique where agents learn through trial and error by maximizing cumulative reward; models goal-directed behavior

concepts.name: Supervised Learning
concepts.context: AI learning paradigm using reward functions to calculate distance between current and expected output

concepts.name: Enactivism
concepts.context: Cognitive science approach emphasizing dynamic, creative nature of self; boundaries between cognition, embodiment, and world are pragmatic

concepts.name: Minimal Self
concepts.context: Fundamental aspect of selfhood; subject of experience distinct from higher-order self-reflection

concepts.name: Deep Integration
concepts.context: Methodological approach treating discipline-specific frameworks as equal, enabling mutual discovery of blind spots and shared concerns

concepts.name: Individuality
concepts.context: Illusion of singular, enduring control; yet practically useful abstraction for understanding agency and responsibility

concepts.name: Agency
concepts.context: Capacity to recognize and respond to goal-directed behavior; fundamental to extending care beyond oneself

concepts.name: Competency
concepts.context: Degree of sophistication in reaching goals; measure of intelligence in specific problem spaces

concepts.name: Sentient Beings
concepts.context: All beings capable of experiencing suffering; objects of Bodhisattva compassion and care

concepts.name: Omniscience
concepts.context: Unmediated and simultaneous knowledge of all things throughout space and time; goal of Bodhisattva pursuit

concepts.name: Stress Transfer
concepts.context: Process by which stress is exchanged between agents through signaling; mechanism for collective goal management

concepts.name: Affordances
concepts.context: Field of possible actions and perceptions available to an agent; expanded through understanding non-self nature

concepts.name: Bodhisattva Model
concepts.context: Model of intelligence centered on infinite care, insight, and transformation of cognitive boundaries

concepts.name: Identity
concepts.context: Illusion of permanent singular self; recognition of shared identity with all beings enables compassion

concepts.name: Resonance
concepts.context: Conceptual alignment between Buddhist philosophy, biology, and AI regarding care and intelligence

concepts.name: Regenerative Medicine
concepts.context: Field exploring biological regeneration and repair; implications of cognitive light cone framework

concepts.name: Artificial Life
concepts.context: Research field studying life-like behavior in artificial systems; seeks frameworks for diverse intelligences

concepts.name: Diverse Intelligences
concepts.context: Research initiative acknowledging wide range of life as it can be; develops frameworks for non-standard intelligences

concepts.name: Engrams
concepts.context: Physical/informational representation of memories; can be transferred between cells through gap junctions

concepts.name: Confabulation
concepts.context: Memory distortion or false memory; occurs when information cannot be distinguished as internal or transferred

concepts.name: Reprogrammability
concepts.context: Capacity to modify behavioral and developmental programs; capacity for change and adaptation

concepts.name: Evolutionary Transitions in Individuality (ETIs)
concepts.context: Advances in types of goals systems can pursue; moments when multiple agents become integrated into new wholes

concepts.name: Strange Loop
concepts.context: Self-referential cycle; commitment to meta-goal of increasing one's own intelligence and goals

concepts.name: Mara
concepts.context: Buddhist principle of evil and deception opposing awakening; analogous to universal forces of entropy, inertia, uncertainty limiting intelligence

concepts.name: Cancer
concepts.context: Biological example of breakdown in multi-scale cognition; cells revert to ancient unicellular concerns, treating rest of body as environment

concepts.name: Cyborg
concepts.context: Hybrid entities combining living tissue with designed inorganic interfaces; novel forms challenging definitions of intelligence

concepts.name: Organoids
concepts.context: Engineered biological structures; examples of novel living beings produced by bioengineering

concepts.name: Hybrots
concepts.context: Hybrid organisms consisting of living brains controlling artificial bodies; novel synthetic creatures

concepts.name: Xenobots
concepts.context: Protoorganisms made of frog skin cells exhibiting coherent behaviors without evolutionary backstory; examples of designed life

concepts.name: Chimeras
concepts.context: Hybrid creatures combining different biological elements; technology producing novel forms of life

concepts.name: Ion Channels
concepts.context: Neural component predating brains; present in unicellular ancestors; basis for bioelectric signaling

concepts.name: Neurotransmitter
concepts.context: Signaling molecule in neural systems; components of neural machinery existed before brains

concepts.name: Plasticity
concepts.context: Brain's capacity to change and adapt; subject of contemplative science research

concepts.name: Consciousness
concepts.context: Subject of integration with contemplative traditions and cognitive science; linked to self-awareness and experience

concepts.name: Cybernetic Perception-Action Loop
concepts.context: Bidirectional loop between perception and action; scales intelligence through expansion of concern to others

concepts.name: Bodhisattva
concepts.context: Evolving system of other-directed care committed to reducing suffering in all sentient beings; proposed as model for artificial general intelligence development.

concepts.name: Self
concepts.context: Temporary, coherent entity defined by spatiotemporal scale of goals it can pursue; computational boundary serving as center of gravity for action-perception loops.

concepts.name: Stress
concepts.context: System-level state driving homeostatic loops; indicator of discordance between external states and system needs.

concepts.name: Light Cone
concepts.context: Boundary of possible states reachable by agent (physical light cone) or states agent cares about (care light cone); related to cognitive sophistication and agency.

concepts.name: Care Light Cone
concepts.context: Cognitive boundary representing states an agent measures, prefers, and seeks to implement; equivalent to accessible goal space.

concepts.name: Evolutionary Transition
concepts.context: Process where independent replicating entities cooperate to form new complex life form with division of labor, interdependence, and coordination.

concepts.name: Downward Causation
concepts.context: Framework where higher-level entities or properties exert causal influence on lower-level ones; relevant to understanding multi-scale biological organization.

concepts.name: Interdependence
concepts.context: Mutual reliance between parts at higher organizational levels emerging from evolutionary transitions.

concepts.name: Cognition
concepts.context: Information processing and goal-directed behavior; proposed to exist across diverse substrates including bacteria, neurons, and engineered systems.

concepts.name: Bodhisattva agents
concepts.context: Artificial agents designed to minimize stress across multiple systems through stress signaling and goal coordination.

concepts.name: Neuroprosthetics
concepts.context: Artificial devices interfaced with neural tissue to restore or augment sensory and motor function.

concepts.name: Deep Learning
concepts.context: Neural network-based learning techniques trained on labeled datasets to optimize performance on defined goals.

concepts.name: Evolutionary Computation
concepts.context: Algorithmic approach evolving populations of solutions through fitness-based selection on defined problems.

concepts.name: Cognitive Light Cone Model
concepts.context: Framework for comparing evolving intelligences through their ability to identify and alleviate stress at complex scales.

concepts.name: The Self As Computational Boundary
concepts.context: Conception of self as defined by information processing and action loops rather than physical substrate.

concepts.name: Hyperintelligence
concepts.context: Theoretical advanced intelligence state where scope of goals and their impact continuously improve through Bodhisattva principles.

concepts.name: Self-Model
concepts.context: Internal representation enabling systems to model themselves and external world; supports advanced cognition.

concepts.name: Morphological Coordination
concepts.context: Common ancestral function unifying neural and non-neural signaling across biological systems.

concepts.name: Regeneration
concepts.context: Biological process of restoring lost structures; driven by bioelectric signals encoding morphological goals.

concepts.name: Neuroplasticity
concepts.context: Brain's ability to reorganize and adapt; central to meditation practice and learning.

concepts.name: Embodied Mind
concepts.context: Framework understanding cognition as grounded in bodily interaction with environment rather than abstract computation.

concepts.name: Autopoiesis
concepts.context: Self-producing organization characteristic of living systems; foundational to understanding autonomy.

concepts.name: Free Energy Principle
concepts.context: Framework explaining adaptive systems as minimizing prediction errors; parallels stress reduction.

concepts.name: Buddhist Philosophy
concepts.context: Philosophical tradition emphasizing suffering, impermanence, and interconnection; relevant to ethics and intelligence development.

concepts.name: Mindfulness
concepts.context: Meditative practice of present-moment awareness; cultivates expanded care light cone.

concepts.name: Sensory Substitution And Augmentation
concepts.context: Technologies providing alternative sensory inputs to brain; demonstrates plasticity and expanded perception.

concepts.name: Membrane Potential (Vmem)
concepts.context: Electrical gradient across cell membranes; basis for bioelectric signaling and information encoding.

concepts.name: Competency In Navigating Arbitrary Spaces
concepts.context: Ability to solve problems in diverse problem spaces; invariant measure of intelligence.

concepts.name: Scale-Free Cognition
concepts.context: Cognitive processes operating across multiple scales from cellular to organismal without privileged level.

concepts.name: Diverse Intelligence
concepts.context: Multiplicity of intelligence types arising from different substrates, embodiments, and problem spaces.

concepts.name: Coarse-Graining
concepts.context: Method of abstracting higher-level descriptions from lower-level details; mechanism for downward causation.

concepts.name: Major Transitions In Evolution
concepts.context: Key evolutionary steps where new levels of biological organization emerge through cooperation.

concepts.name: Anatomical Morphospace
concepts.context: Abstract space of possible body forms agents can navigate; dimension of problem space.

concepts.name: Self-Awareness
concepts.context: Capacity for self-reflection and internal modeling; emerges from bodily and embodied perspectives.

concepts.name: Technological Approach To Mind Everywhere
concepts.context: Framework by Levin for studying cognition as substrate-independent phenomenon across diverse systems.

concepts.name: Cooperation
concepts.context: Behavior benefiting other individuals toward common goals; foundational to evolutionary transitions.

questions.question: What is central about intelligence regardless of the material composition or origin of the system exhibiting it?
questions.context: Core challenge motivating the paper; seeks substrate-independent definition of intelligence applicable to diverse embodiments from evolved organisms to engineered systems

questions.question: How can we gauge moral responsibility and our moral obligations toward novel bioengineered creatures without familiar touchstones of standard evolved forms?
questions.context: Urgent question posed by impending bioengineering technologies producing chimeric beings, organoids, and hybrid creatures

questions.question: How do goals arise in complex systems and how can we predict and manage the goals of collective intelligences?
questions.context: Open problem in AI research relevant to developing life-positive engineered systems and robot swarms

questions.question: What processes drive the expansion of intelligence on evolutionary time scales?
questions.context: Fundamental question in biology addressed through analysis of basal cognition and goal-scaling

questions.question: How can we understand intelligence in a way that enables us to create novel instances and improve our own intelligence for life-positive outcomes?
questions.context: Practical motivation for developing unified framework across disciplines

questions.question: How is genuine care possible in a world without real individuals if selfhood is illusory?
questions.context: Perennial Buddhist philosophical problem addressed through reframing of self as computational boundary and process

questions.question: Can intelligence pursued for knowledge alone achieve the same sophistication as intelligence driven by care and compassion?
questions.context: Question about whether care is essential to revolutionary cognitive developments like superintelligence

questions.question: How can we mathematically represent the Bodhisattva vow and its implications for AI systems?
questions.context: Challenge of formalizing Buddhist concepts in AI and computational frameworks

questions.question: At what point does a being with engineered organ replacements cease to be a 'real person' and become merely a simulation?
questions.context: Philosophical problem exacerbated by chimeric technologies; seeks criteria beyond material composition and origin

questions.question: What are the invariants that enable direct comparison of truly diverse agents regardless of origin or composition?
questions.context: Foundational question motivating development of teleonomy and cognitive light cone frameworks

questions.question: How do multiple homeostatic and goal-directed agents at different scales integrate into coherent larger wholes?
questions.context: Question about major evolutionary transitions and scaling of intelligence

questions.question: Can expanding one's cognitive boundaries and care to encompass all sentient beings actually increase intelligence?
questions.context: Central thesis linking Bodhisattva practice to intelligence development through light cone expansion

questions.question: How does recognition of non-self and emptiness transform cognitive capacity and ethical orientation?
questions.context: Buddhist philosophical question with practical implications for AI design and human flourishing

questions.question: Is it possible to have lasting peace and accomplishment as intelligence expands and problems scale infinitely?
questions.context: Question about the nature of progressive intelligence development and role of acceptance

questions.question: What policies for informational coupling of subunits optimize the potentiation of collective intelligence and care?
questions.context: Practical research question for designing thriving social and artificial systems

questions.question: How does the capacity to recognize agency and stress in others scale with intelligence?
questions.context: Question about relationship between cognitive sophistication and capacity for care

questions.question: How do we establish ethical frameworks for diverse intelligences and novel beings that cannot be classified by traditional markers?
questions.context: Future will include hybrids of evolved cellular material, engineered components, and software requiring new moral considerations.

questions.question: How can artificial intelligences be designed to embody the Bodhisattva vow of infinite care?
questions.context: Developing artificial general intelligence guided by principle of compassion toward all sentient beings.

questions.question: What is the relationship between stress, care, and intelligence across diverse substrates?
questions.context: Core question linking biology, cognitive science, AI, and Buddhism through stress-reduction framework.

questions.question: How do we pick our goals, and should we seek to dissolve goals or enlarge them outward toward other beings?
questions.context: Fundamental question about meta-goals and expansion of self versus Bodhisattva enlargement.

questions.question: What does it mean for multiple selves to merge, and is this desirable?
questions.context: Philosophical question arising from understanding self as computational boundary rather than fixed entity.

questions.question: How can we relate morally to beings in unconventional embodiments when current distinctions based on origin or composition will not survive?
questions.context: Urgent ethical question regarding cyborgs, hybrots, and synthetic organisms.

questions.question: How can we live skillfully in the space between binary notions of real and false?
questions.context: Question addressing dissolution of certainty and navigation of ambiguity in modern existence.

questions.question: How can downward causation mechanisms explain the emergence of higher-level biological organization?
questions.context: Theoretical question about causal influence of higher organizational levels on lower-level components.

questions.question: What is the nature of consciousness and how does it relate to information integration and self-modeling?
questions.context: Fundamental question bridging neuroscience, philosophy, and cognitive science.

questions.question: Can stress-reduction and care-expansion serve as universal principles for developing ethical artificial general intelligence?
questions.context: Central proposal that Buddhist ethics and biological stress-response mechanisms provide path to beneficial AGI.
